This weapon is a polearm with a large blunt object attached to one end.
Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this holy symbol. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it.

Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells, and you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature’s uses. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn.
While attuned to this belt, your Strength score changes to 19. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 19.

You can channel the giant's essence as a Bonus Action to gain the benefits of the Enlarge portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 minute. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
Merchants Luck. When worn (no attunement) the wearer gains advantage on the first persuasion check made every day used in relation to a trade (sale, purchase or barter).

Insightful Eye. When worn (and attuned) the wearer cannot be deceived without being aware of the attempted deceit. The wearer cannot read minds but will immediately know when someone is not being completely truthful and have insight into the degree/scope of the subterfuge in question.

Spirit Bound. When worn (and attuned) the wearers spirit/soul is bound to the diamond and becomes absorbed by the diamond upon death. When absorbed the spirit remains in the diamond until released. The soul is released when the necklace is worn by another creature and the soul determines that the creature is a suitable host and the soul will then take over the host body and imbue it with all its powers, traits and skills.
These bracers are made of hardened Dwarven Steel and are imbued with strong defensive magic, to protect the Dwarven War Mages in battle. While wearing these bracers your AC is 14 + DEX.

set.name: attunement
set.addition: by a sorcerer, wizard, or warlock

description.p: This +1 arrow has a icy blue shaft adorned with chardalyn razor fletching and matching head, can also be used as a dart.

Levistus' Ire.When attuned, this arrow adds a d6 of cold damage when it hits along with returning upon reaching or missing its target. Additionally, hitting a target with this arrow makes your next shot against that target have advantage, and a critical hit the target is wounded and loses 10 feet of movement speed and 5 feet for each after the first until their next long rest is completed.
Your Intelligence score is 19 while you are attuned to this Headband. It has no Effect if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.
It also grants you telepathy (120ft) and you can freely choose to have the headband glow with a purplish inner light (15 bright/15 dim) while you are attuned to it.

This wand has 5 charges and is made of translucent crystal resembling a slender icicle. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the *ice storm* spell (save DC 17) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 4th-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand melts into water and is destroyed.

This hand sized maul is made of Dwarven Steel inscribed with thunder runes, it hums with a light buzz. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. The damage the weapon deals is thunder, and after a throw the hammer returns to the thrower's hand like a lightning bolt.

Once per day as an Action you can speak the command phrase *"BY ODINS BEARD"* and throw the hammer at a target or an unoccupied space, if at a target make an attack roll, on hit or miss any creature within 20 feet of the impact must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 lightning and 4d6 lightning strikes the area and the hammer crashes with a thunderclap. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the hammer can still be used as a magic weapon.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

Attuning to the sword establishes a link between you and the weapon becoming an extension of yourself; you gain proficency with this rapier, you are unable to be forcefully disarmed of the weapon, immediately after an attack the weapon flies back to your hand, and it deals an extra 1d8 psychic damage on hit as it draws on your psionic abilities to inflict mental damage.
While you are attuned to this sword your Intelligence score is 20, unless already higher and you also gain telepathy with any target you can see.

This wand is made from many rare woods twisted and fused together using the raw power of the Weave by the Witch Neia Kelxisys, Vekzian Hero of the Great War. The wand was her chosen tool of destruction when facing off against the warring nations of Kol and Eshea allowing her to move among the battlefield with ease.

You have advantage on initiative rolls while you are holding the wand. In addition whenever you use a spell slot to cast a spell, you can immediately teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you.

The Adventurers Initiative ID is keyed to each individual Adventurer and functions as your pass around Térûvia as it is used to reap any of the benefits that come with being and Adventurer like lodging, rations, ammunition, and basic components. It also functions as a coin purse for the keyed Adventurer storing all coin one might encounter and converting between Silver, Gold, and Platinum at will. The ID also lets the Adventurer know when the damage or effect they may be trying to inflict on a target is useful or not calling out Immunities and Resistances along with Vulnerabilities.

The Adventurer's Guide to Térûvia contains the basic knowledge an Adventurer would need to navigate Térûvia. In addition to information the book contains a map with live tracking of the book's location to aid in navigation, along with the forms needed for reports and the means to send them via transport slot on the back of the cover. This handbook, can't be damaged by fire, acid, or immersion in water. In addition, the book doesn't deteriorate with age.

This spiraling pendant is made of three magic-sensitive panes of colorful crystal. Each piece of crystal is attuned to a different arcane element. If you can cast spells, you can use the amulet as a spellcasting focus while you're attuned to it.

The amulet has 4 charges and regains 2 expended charges daily at dawn. When you deal cold, fire, or lightning damage to a single creature while wearing the amulet, you can expend any number of its charges to reroll that many of the cold, fire, or lightning damage dice. You must use the new rolls. Whenever you take cold, fire, or lightning damage from a hostile creature, the amulet regains 1 charge.

The Belt of the Tempest was found by Logen and the other Witchlight Warriors inside an ancient temple of Atlanta, it formed from a Divine Spark granted to him after proving his mettle. The Divine Spark took the form of a thick dark blue leather belt adorned with large metal plates covered in storm-based iconogrophy.
Dormant. While attuned to the Belt of the Tempest:

ul.li: You have resistance to lightning damage and thunder damage.
Your Strength score is raised by 2 to a Maximum of 30.

description.p: Storm Avatar.In addition, you can use a bonus action to become a Storm Avatar for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits for the duration:

ul.li: You have immunity to lightning damage and thunder damage.

When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals bludgeoning damage, it deals thunder damage instead. When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals piercing or slashing damage, it deals lightning damage instead.

As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to be struck by lightning. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description.p: Once you use the Belt of the Tempest's Storm Avatar property, that property can't be used again until the next dawn.

A Spellshard of endless volume able to hold as much information as one can find, gifted to Jarzamel by Ceritas herself imbued with her Divine energy, given as a reward for the Witchlight Warriors answering her call.

A wizard can use this spellshard as a spellbook, with the usual cost in gold and time to scribe a spell into the shard. You can use an action to open your mind to the shard, seeing its content in your mind. On subsequent rounds, reading the text or scribing new text on blank pages in the shard requires concentration (as if concentrating on a spell) and takes the same amount of time it takes you to read and write normally. Thinking of a particular phrase or topic draws you to the first section in the shard that addresses it.
Dormant. You can use the Mote as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it, in addition it has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

ul.li: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
When you prepare wizard spells attuned to the mote the number of spells you can prepare increases by 1.
The Gold cost for Spell Copying is halved while using the Mote as your spellbook.

description.p: The Bloodwell of Wealth was once a standard Bloodwell Vial but has been imbued with a Divine Spark, when Gerry DeMarkk and the Witchlight Warriors delved into a Temple of Rikkus to prove their worth.The Divine Spark changed the existing Bloobwell Vial that called to Gerry all those years ago in that shop, into a more extravagant version adorned with fine gems and the golden symbol of Rikkus etched into the glass vial. To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash.
Dormant. You can use the Bloodwell Vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it, in addition it has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

ul.li: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
When you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.
You can cast use the vial to cast the following spells: *cure wounds* [as a 2nd-level spell], *lesser restoration*, and *shield of faith*.

description.p: When Unamed and the Witchlight Warriors were tested by Haymil the spark given to Unamed took the form of two rings. These paired rings are engraved with small knives and other bladed weapons in an intricate pattern that conceals the true design to anyone but the attuned wearer.

Dormant. As part of the attunement to these rings you must choose weapons to bond with each, once bonded the weapon exists in an extra dimensional space inside the ring, is considered on your person, and can be drawn to your hand a flick of the wrist and are stored by you at will as long as they exist on the same plane. You also gain the following additonal benefits while attuned:

ul.li: You gain a +1 bonus to your bonded melee weapon strikes damage and to hit.
You gain the Two-Weapon Fighting fighting style.

When you successfully use your sneak attack as part of your attack action, you can make a second sneak attack strike, with your offhand weapon as part of Two-Weapon Fighting, against another target using half the number of Sneak Attack dice for your level (round up).

description.p: This item appears to be a longsword hilt with a place for a small badge on the bottom. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure energy to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property and deals force instead of slashing. If you are proficient with shortswords or longswords, you are proficient with the Sword of the Elements.

After the Badge of the Tribunal is put into the slot you can attune to the item and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, when you hit an elemental with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 force damage.

These dark leather boots look to be of common make, but a subtle pattern of swirling storm clouds upon their soles suggests the potency of their enchantment. You can activate these boots as part of your movement, gaining the following benefits until the end of your turn:
You have a flying speed of 90 feet.
Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
Whenever you move within 5 feet of a hostile creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d8 lightning damage. A creature can’t be damaged in this way more than once per turn.
Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn.
